thread.title: East Dundee approves new gun shop
thread.title_full: East Dundee approves new gun shop

author: Erin Sauder
title: East Dundee approves new gun shop
text:
East Dundee approves new gun shop Erin Sauder / The Courier-News Trident Custom Coatings LLC is expanding into the purchase and sale of guns in East Dundee. Trident Custom Coatings LLC is expanding into the purchase and sale of guns in East Dundee. (Erin Sauder / The Courier-News) Privacy Policy 
An East Dundee firearms coating business has the OK from village officials to expand into the purchase and sale of guns. 
A special-use permit request from Tyson Cobb, owner of Trident Custom Coatings LLC, 555 Plate Drive, was approved at Monday's board meeting. 
Trident specializes in hydrographic printing, DuraCoat applications to hunting gear and other types of firearms, as well as other protective coatings. According to Trident's website, the company has differentiated itself "by coating anything from engine parts to mailboxes, and much more." 
A public hearing on Cobb's request was held during a January planning and zoning meeting. Commission members recommended approval of the special-use permit subject to several conditions, including that Trident ensures inventory is locked in a secure space with a village-approved burglar alarm, records all firearm sales and purchases and makes them available to the police chief, and operates the gun shop as an accessory use to the coating business. Crystal Lake attorney during a drunken-driving investigation, police said they made a bigger discovery when they searched the man's home: a cache of 56 handguns and rifles and thousands of rounds of ammunition.
Authorities apparently... 
After allegedly finding a loaded weapon in the possession of a Crystal Lake attorney during a drunken-driving investigation, police said they made a bigger discovery when they searched the man's home: a cache of 56 handguns and rifles and thousands of rounds of ammunition. 
Authorities apparently... (Robert McCoppin and Tony Briscoe) 
Village Administrator Bob Skurla said the company's property is located in a designated M-1 limited manufacturing district where a gun shop is allowed under a special-use permit. 
Before the vote, Trustee Rob Gorman asked Police Chief Terry Mee and Village Attorney Kathleen Orr if they were comfortable with the proposal. 
Both said yes. 
"We have a major gun retailer in town," Mee said, referring to GAT Guns on Route 25. "And we've experienced no problems there. I'll be scheduling a walk-through with the owner and see if there's anything we need to talk about." 
Orr added, "The regulations are there to support you in terms of making sure it's properly run." 
Trustee Jeff Lynam asked if guns would be tested at the site. 
Mee said no. 
"They'd have to have a range to do that and they're not set up for that," he said. 
Erin Sauder is a freelance reporter for the Courier-News.
